postal_label_generator_service

Class PostalLabelServiceController

  • java.lang.Object
    • postal_label_generator_service.PostalLabelServiceController

  • public class PostalLabelServiceController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the getPostalData(spark.Request, spark.Response) method for a postal label microservice most practical to utilize for any kind of web store. The idea is when a customer of a webshop places an order the client (the store itself) calls the API with the name and shipping address and immediately gets back a PDF document with the same details in a format convenient to print out and use as a postal label for shipping.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      int getPostalData(spark.Request request, spark.Response response)

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static PostalLabelServiceController getInstance()

      • getPostalData

        public int getPostalData(spark.Request request,
                         spark.Response response)
                  throws org.json.JSONException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Serves a PDF to save containing the text it reads out from the request body.

        Requests a JSONObject in the body of a POST request that has a corresponding name and shipping address as values to the following keys in that exact order:

        • "name"
        • "country"
        • "city"
        • "address"
        • "zipcode"

        In case the request's built up according to above rules the method responds with a PDF doc with the received postal data written in it. This app uses the spark web framework to create the API endpoints so the parameters can be found in Request and Response respectively.

        Parameters:
        request - a spark request object which body should contain the shipping details
        response - a spark response object where the resulting PDF travels
        Returns:
        a status message 200 if the content of the JSON meets the requirements
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - JSON in the request body differs from the specification
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Spark
